verses.verse: O God<WH430>, you have cast us off<WH2186>, you have scattered<WH6555> us<WH599>, you have been displeased; O turn yourself to us again<WH7725>.
You have made the earth<WH776> to tremble<WH7493>; you have broken<WH6480> it<WH7495>: heal the breaches<WH7667> there<WH4131>; for it shakes.
You have showed<WH7200> your people<WH5971> hard things<WH7186>: you have made us to drink<WH8248> the wine<WH3196> of astonishment<WH8653>.
You have given<WH5414> a banner<WH5251> to them that fear<WH3373> you<WH5127>, that it may be displayed because<WH6440> of the truth<WH7189>. Selah<WH5542>.
That your beloved<WH3039> may be delivered<WH2502>; save<WH3467> with your right hand<WH3225>, and hear me<WH6030>.
God<WH430> has spoken<WH1696> in his holiness<WH6944>; I will rejoice<WH5937>, I will divide<WH2505> Shechem<WH7927>, and measure out<WH4058> the valley<WH6010> of Succoth<WH5523>.
Gilead<WH1568> is mine<WH4519>, and Manasseh is mine<WH669>; Ephraim also is the strength<WH4581> of my head<WH7218>; Judah<WH3063> is my lawgiver<WH2710>;
Moab<WH4124> is my washpot<WH5518>; over Edom<WH123> will I cast out<WH7993> my shoe<WH5275>: Philistia<WH6429>, triumph you because of me<WH7321>.
Who will bring<WH2986> me into the strong<WH4692> city<WH5892>? who will lead<WH5148> me into Edom<WH123>?
Will not you<WH430>, O God, which had cast us off<WH2186>? and you<WH430>, O God, which did not go out<WH3318> with our armies<WH6635>?
Give<WH3051> us help<WH5833> from trouble<WH6862>: for vain<WH7723> is the help<WH8668> of man<WH120>.
Through God<WH430> we shall do<WH6213> valiantly<WH2428>: for he it is that shall tread down<WH947> our enemies<WH6862>.
